abstracts.cdata!:
The Urban Development Project for Bhutan
            aims to ensure that the affected households are provided
            assistance and support to enable them to improve their
            living standards. Therefore, this plan is concerned with
            only adverse impacts associated with the project and
            mitigation measures to be considered. Out of the ten towns
            funded under the project, eight towns involved private land
            acquisition owned by 77 households. In order to ensure that
            resettlement is completed prior to commencement of civil
            works; the civil work is proposed to be taken up in those
            stretches where land is free of settlement. A detailed
            resettlement implementation plan (RIP) has been prepared
            mainly based on the policy framework for land acquisition
            and resettlement. The project will ensure that the
            rehabilitation package will be implemented before civil
            works are started.
